description: Translate only rows with some species info

Counts number of layers based on the presence of a not null value for attributes representing each layer. Custom function decides if NFL layer is present based on rules in NFL table.

Maps source value to CROWN_CLOSURE_LOWER using lists of values
Maps source values to HEIGHT_LOWER
Maps source values to HEIGHT_UPPER
Brush and two alder classes are inlcuded in the fornon attribute. Note that these are not explicitly labelled as non-productive in the manual but we think they fit better here than in the nfl table.

Maps source value to SPECIES_PER_1 by multiplying by 10
Maps source value to SPECIES_2 using lookup table. Uses a second column in the lookup table to allow the layer 2 source values to be translated to different target values for species 1 and species 2.
Maps source value to SPECIES_PER_2 by multiplying by 10
Maps source value to SPECIES_3 using lookup table
Maps source value to SPECIES_PER_3 by multiplying by 10. Layer 2 only has 2 species so rules for species 3 and 4 only need to account for layer 1.
Maps source value to SPECIES_4 using lookup table
Maps source value to SPECIES_PER_4 by multiplying by 10. Layer 2 only has 2 species so rules for species 3 and 4 only need to account for layer 1.

Concatenates values from 2 attributes and maps to SITE_CLASS using list of values. Usually only one of the attributes will occur per row in the source data, the other will be set to 0. Target values are based on the translation for the non-zero value.
